amendatorysection.para: Except as provided in section 81-1813, no compensation shall be awarded under the Nebraska Crime Victim's Reparations Act from the Victim's Compensation Fund in an amount in excess of ten thousand dollars for each applicant per incident unless expenses for job retraining or similar employment-related rehabilitative services for the victim are deemed necessary. In such case, amounts in excess of ten thousand dollars shall be used only for such purposes. Each award shall be paid in installments unless the hearing officer or committee decides otherwise.

annotation.para: Children who have lost the financial support of their mother for at least the remainder of their minority are limited to single award of $10,000 each by act, even though lost support would total more than $10,000. Lambert v. Nebraska Cr. Vict. Rep. Bd., 214 Neb. 817, 336 N.W.2d 320 (1983).
